185833990.review:
A jornada da nossa protagonista Velvet é, sem dúvida, bem intensa, ela já começa com cenas mostrando o passado dela antes dos acontecimentos e como a fez chegar no ponto que faz ela buscar vingança ao seu mestre.

Ao longo do jogo, nossa protagonista toma escolhas difíceis e moralmente questionável, à medida que ela segue seu caminho em busca de vingança. E o jogo faz um excelente trabalho em explorar as complexidades da moralidade até onde vale suas ações para a cumprir nosso objetivo de vingança, tanto que no começo, ela repete bastante que não se importar com nada e só busca vingança,.

Além disso, um dos pontos mais profundos da narrativa é como ela lida com os seus próprios sentimentos, e como o pesar e a raiva moldam sua personalidade e suas decisões. Ela é uma protagonista que diferente de muitos outros heróis que buscam um propósito altruísta, ela carrega um peso psicológico e emocional muito grande, o que a torna uma figura extremamente humana e com a qual é fácil se identificar, eu, particulamente, muitas partes, senti o peso junto.

Cara, de verdade, tem momentos que  você tá ali acompanhando os diálogos e simplesmente parece que você tá lá, tem momentos que tive vontade de abraçar ela, a Velvet kkkk.

A relação dela com os outros membros do grupo também é central para o desenvolvimento da história. Cada um deles tem seus próprios traumas e motivações, o que cria uma dinâmica interessante e, em certos momentos, dolorosa. A complexidade das interações entre os personagens adiciona mais camadas à narrativa, revelando que o caminho de Velvet não é um que ela trilha sozinha, mesmo que, em muitos momentos, pareça ser.

Em termos de jogabilidade,  as batalhas são dinâmicas e fluidas, e muitas vezes não é só ficar batendo, dependendo do inimigo, é bom planejar uma estratégia para conseguir vencer, um exemplo mesmo, são os chefes de áreas, muitos você não consegue vencer só indo batendo, eles lançam debufs que fazer você ficar lento, paralisado, então tem que ter estratégia nas lutas, mas o que realmente se destaca é o uso da história e das escolhas para impactar o ritmo das lutas. A maneira como as batalhas refletem a intensidade emocional da protagonista adiciona uma camada de imersão ao jogo, ela gritando de raiva em certas nessas, principalmente quando enfrentamos o nosso mestre, o Artorius.  Mas tem um ponto bacana aqui, quando você descobre as motivações do Artorius, quando você ver as coisas pelo ponto de vista dele, você percebe que tanto ele, quanto a Velvet, acabaram caindo em um caminho similiar,  um caminho de ódio e tristeza por perderem que amavam, e isso é o que mais tocou.

Na luta final contra o Artorius, a cena em que o Artorius fala que no dia que ele perdeu seu filho e sua esposa, ele diz, que sempre se perguntou se as coisas fossem diferentes se quem tivesse morrido fosse a  Velvet e seu irmão, e em contraponto, Velvet responde que ela queria ter morrido naquele dia. 

Outro ponto impactante, é que quando Velvet derrota o Artorius, ela atravessa a espada nele, no mesmo momento, antes de começar o dialogo que falei, ela começa a chorar, pois no fim de tudo, Artorius também era membro da sua família, ele é o marido de sua falecida irmã, e foi ele que cuidou dela e ensinou ela a lutar, e quando você ver as coisas pela visão de ambos, você até se lamenta pelo rumo da história.

No final das contas, Tales of Berseria é uma obra que aborda temas de vingança, arrependimento, sacrifício e, acima de tudo, a complexidade das emoções humanas. Não há respostas fáceis ou soluções claras, e isso faz com que a história seja memorável e, talvez, uma das mais sombrias e impactantes dos jogos que joguei.

O final é me pegou, simplesmente, me pegou, não achei que no fim do jogo, Velvet iria se sacrificar, enfim...

É um jogo simplesmente maravilhoso que fez eu me apaixonar. 

Recomendo, ou seja.. COMPREM E JOGUEM, É UMA ORDEM.

185400883.review:
A dark and emotional journey in search of revenge
Tales of Berseria is a fascinating JRPG action game that deeply explores the themes of revenge, morality, and redemption. With a dark narrative, unforgettable characters, and fast-paced combat, this game stands out as one of the most unique in the Tales of.
History
You take on the role of Velvet Crowe, a young woman turned into an antihero by a tragic loss. Her journey begins with a quest for revenge, but develops into a struggle against forces that threaten to plunge the world into chaos. The game takes place approximately 1,000 years before the events of Tales of Zestiria, showing how the struggles of this era lay the foundation for the story in Zestiria.
Strengths
✔️ A dark and thrilling narrative
Tales of Berseria impresses with its dark atmosphere and strong emphasis on the anti-heroine, which sets it apart from the traditional hero's journey.
✔️ Deep characters
Each member of the group has a unique personality,

185387910.review:
With only an hour in I found the storyline too predictable right out of the gate compared to Tales of Zesteria and Tales of Arise, where I couldn't figure it out and was wondering what was happening next. At least in Tales of Arise, they didn't try to be subtle about the world building at the start. They just told you how it was and built the world from there. A lot of the plot points of what's about to happen are blatantly obvious even though they're trying to hide it in the world building. Typical slice of life anime tropes that are bland. The acting feels half-hearted at best.

I'm just going to give spoilers here with no spoiler tag. Mainly because its so early ingame and to show how bad the writing is:
Luphicet said something along the lines of (not direct quote): "This is a compass. Its made to be level regardless of how bad the waves at sea are. Its perfect for an adventure!" Just... really? I know I'm playing and RPG/adventure game. There is no reason to bring this up. Its incredibly cringe.
I got to the point where Luphicet needed to be found because he wandered off without permission. I already knew that he was going to get into trouble (or Velvet get into trouble on her way to him or on their way home). The day before her weapon master/father figure/teacher said to be careful there were daemons around. I didn't even get to find him. I already knew what was going to happen that would set off your need to go on an adventure. I stopped playing shortly after this point. It was just too bland.

Fps is locked to 60fps with jittering in the framerate. Get special K mod to smooth this out. Controls feel even more clunky than in Zesteria. They tried to smooth it out from Zesteria, but made it feel even weirder with KB/M. In Zesteria it the turns were sharper and more responsive. Even with both Zesteria and Berseria being limited to 8 cardinal directions due to how the default controls being for a controller with WASD.

You can see the evolution from Zesteria to Arise here overall. But it somehow manages to be worse than both of them combined.

Buy on sale if you are becoming a die-hard "Tales of" fan. Otherwise, avoid this Tales of title.

185311209.review:
Amei minha experiência com o jogo! Diálogos excelentes, personagens muito bem escritos, com ótimo desenvolvimento. 

E uma história muito densa, o tema em discussão desse jogo é extremamente impactante. Acima da média, no quesito de jogabilidade é o melhor Tales que joguei até então. O jogo pode ficar meio massante para alguns porém isso não foi algo que me incomodou pq a história e os personagens carregam o jogo nas costas. 

O sistema de Combate é o melhor que joguei até então da franquia, porém é muito complexo e eu não utilizei acredito que metade dos sistemas existentes que eu poderia, mas zerei mesmo assim, portanto você não precisa ser um expert para conseguir zerar o jogo. RECOMENDO MUITO que testem!

185302343.review:
Overall, a really excellent and emotionally moving game. I've never played a Tales game before and that wasn't an issue for playing this one. If you do all the side quests, it's about a 110 hour game (+10 playing the mini game card game five zillion times, in my case :P ). It's a very character/story driven game about what we fight for in life and why.

My one complaint is that there are some iffy conversation topics throughout, including the repeated sexualizing of a child/their relationships, lots of gender stereotyping comments (men all like bugs, women are all complicated, etc), the inclusion of a (kinda creepy) childlike sidekick constantly trying to be sexual with adult women and one character's genuine abuse of that sidekick being presented as funny. 

Overall though, definitely recommended. Engaging throughout, well written, believable character-building dialogue, and certainly an emotionally poignant (and sad) story.

185197876.review: Пойдёт чисто субъективное мнение. Сам я никогда не был фанатом японских ролевых игр. Как-то купил эту игру на распродаже. И вот появилось время и я решил попробовать этот жанр. Я не являюсь фанатом анимэ жанра, но следует отдать должное. Пейзажи и персонажи красивые. Сами персонажи странные. С одной стороны, они много болтают и это не минус. Слушать болтовню очень интересно. Больше узнаешь про персонажей. С другой, ведут себя персонажи по дурацки. Та же ведьма. Чего она постоянно пищит и ведёт себя как ребенок переросток?  Рокуро который вот я тебя убью и тут же с зависимостью у рта спрашивает где мы видели меч. Завязка сюжета очень интересная. Но я не могу его воспринимать серьезно когда все пищат, корчат рожи и встречают говорящих котег со словом "мияу".  В игре хорошая спокойная музыка. А вот боевая это просто гитарный рок. Ну такое себе. Нет эпика. Нет серьезности. Геймплей странный. Он напоминает какой-то QTE. Управление неудобное. Да и мобы на тебя прут постоянно. Задалбываешься их убивать. За бой падает опыт. Как его использовать? Что качается? Что нет? Непонятно. В общем, мне не понравилось. Как-то всё скучновато.

It's tales... but berserk. Our lead Velvet is Guts and her goal is to defeath Griffith. 

I have tried to get into tales since symphonia all the way back when i was in middle school on the game cube with symphonia. And this one, berseria, finally did it for me. 

I think all of them will be worth trying but this one's more unique premise with an anti-hero was what drove me to choose this one. If you're like me, this one might be the one for you.

185144961.review:
If I were to describe this game, it'd be like if Blazblue, .Hack//G.U. and Xenoblade 1 were mixed together with a hint of P5 and it is nearly perfect. 

The battle system while confusing at first you can find a good compromise and definitely get a good feel for it after a while. Though I did play on normal and mainly played either Velvet and Magilou which did make it a bit on the easy side, but personally I’d rather a game be too easy than too hard.

The story was fantastic with an that’s pretty bittersweet but with the game being a prequel to Zestiria I can understand, and I honestly can’t think of a single character I don’t like (except maybe Bienfu) and even the side characters get some really good moments as well.

This is definitely up there as one of my new favorite RPGs and really good entry point as my first Tales of game

Also Magilou, best girl Eizen, best boy, Velvet, best mom

185139807.review:
Simply put, this is probably my favourite RPG story. The side stories for each party member all have fulfilling conclusions that cement their motivations and the conclusion to the main story is one I shall always treasure.

The gameplay is dated and less than it could be, though when everything gels, it does feel satisfying. Though my gameplay on Steam is at around 70 hours as of writing, I have completed it three times on console (and near completion on the PC)

It isn't a hard game, per se, though there can be quite unpleasant spikes as the combat system progresses (ways to chain encounters and increase the odds of a rare almost-boss enemies that if you're unprepared can destroy you very quickly)

185120518.review:
[h2]A Dark and Emotional Journey of Vengeance[/h2]
[i]Tales of Berseria[/i] is a captivating action JRPG that delves deeply into themes of vengeance, morality, and redemption. With a dark narrative, unforgettable characters, and fast-paced combat, it stands out as one of the most unique entries in the [i]Tales of[/i] series.

[h3]Story[/h3]
You take on the role of Velvet Crowe, a young woman turned into an anti-heroine by a tragic loss. Her journey begins with a quest for revenge but evolves into a fight against forces that threaten to plunge the world into chaos. The game is set approximately 1,000 years before the events of [i]Tales of Zestiria[/i], showing how the struggles of this era lay the groundwork for the story in [i]Zestiria[/i].

[h3]Strengths[/h3]
[b]✔️ Dark and gripping narrative[/b]
[i]Tales of Berseria[/i] impresses with its dark atmosphere and strong focus on an anti-heroine, setting it apart from the traditional hero’s journey.

[b]✔️ Deep characters[/b]
Every party member has a unique personality, a moving backstory, and a crucial role in the plot.

[b]✔️ Fast-paced combat[/b]
The flexible and action-packed combat system allows for creative combos and personalized fighting styles.

[b]✔️ Emotional themes[/b]
The story tackles heavy topics like loss, sacrifice, and moral conflict, offering a mature gaming experience.

[b]✔️ Atmospheric soundtrack[/b]
The soundtrack perfectly underscores the game’s dark and emotional moments, enhancing the immersive experience.

[h3]Weaknesses[/h3]
[b]❌ Repetitive environments[/b]
Many areas look similar and can feel repetitive, making exploration somewhat monotonous.

[b]❌ Difficulty balancing[/b]
Some battles, especially against optional bosses, can have sudden difficulty spikes, requiring extra preparation or grinding.

[b]❌ Technical limitations[/b]
The graphical quality, especially in environmental details and character animations, shows that the game was originally developed for older consoles. This might disappoint players who value modern visuals.

[h3]Achievements[/h3]
There are 51 achievements in total, all of which can be unlocked in a single playthrough except for one, which may require a second run. None of the achievements are missable, meaning that careful planning can secure most of them on the first try.

[h3](Not) Recommended for[/h3]
[b]✔️ Recommended for:[/b]
• Players who enjoy dark and profound stories
• Fans of JRPGs with emotional themes and moral complexity
• Those who prefer flexible, action-packed combat systems

[b]❌ Not recommended for:[/b]
• Players looking for open-world exploration
• Those who expect cutting-edge graphics

[h3]Final Verdict[/h3]
[i]Tales of Berseria[/i] is an outstanding JRPG that excels through its dark narrative and captivating characters. Velvet’s story offers many emotional moments that leave a lasting impression. The game dares to break new ground with its anti-heroine and morally complex themes, making it a unique and memorable experience. Despite minor flaws, it’s a must-play for fans of story-driven RPGs! 🖤

[b]Note:[/b] My playtime does not reflect the actual duration of the game. For a realistic estimate, I recommend checking [url=https://howlongtobeat.com]HowLongToBeat[/url].

185099723.review:
Still an amazing game.

Story:

A heart wrenching tale, following Velvet and a band of misfits. On the Scarlet Night, Velvet's life would fall apart, becoming a Therion and being held captive on a prison island. Her hatred for a man who was once part of her family for sacrificing her brother was her drive. However, as the story goes along. You see she faces hardships, endures terrible truths.

Though most of all, you see as she grows and tackles her challenges. Her tale is a tragic one, and this steadily builds as she takes on the hatred of the world as the Lord of Calamity. You see how she lost everything, but eventually finds a place among pirates and others.

And despite her path, she is shown to have a soft side. The characters, all of them blend very well together, their differences is what unites them against a common goal. And the twist being that the savior was the oppressor, and the one the people most loathe was actually their savior.

This game really hammers in the grey line of morality, as well as how the common feelings of selfishness is just what makes people human. There will come hard times, some more difficult than the last, but it is not something to shy away from.

To cut it short, it does well to leave a lasting impression with valuable lessons.

"Why do birds fly?"

A very basic question, with great complexity. And Velvet's answer is one that will hit deep.

System:

The battle system is more complex the deeper you get into it, but pretty easy to get into. What is needed to be known is that you can use 16 artes + 4 extra. You have SG which acts as the cost, and BG which is the cost for Mystic Artes. 

Learning the system is key to making battles easier in the harder difficulties. An example? Velvet does more damage the lower her life is when she is in her Therion state. If she can stun the enemy, which makes them vulnerable. On top of being at low HP, her damage shoots through the roof.

Little things like these, which can be made easier with weakness exploits.

Maps:

Quite a lot, and pretty large, with its details being really good.

Music:

Amazing. This game knows how to use it to tell a magnificent story. Some of the most heart wrenching, but also exciting ones when need be. Plus, the placement of it lands very well. The music reflects the theme of the game very well.

Art Style:

Very good, and even better with the animation scenes.

Overall:

Tales of Berseria is basically the height of the series. The bar was set insanely high on this one. It is a tale of not only vengeance, but more importantly. Loss, despair, happiness in the face of sadness. What one is willing to do to achieve their desires. Though, more importantly. A tale that makes the world feel alive, and through the characters that grow close like family. 

You see as they share good and bad times, how they live their life and push forward from their beliefs. A story where what the surface shows isn't what it appears to be. There is a lot to take in with this game, more than I can explain. So, head on in. ^^

184985492.review:
I like the game, it is fun to weave in multiple weaknesses and get huge combo's going as Velvet, it's really taking advantage of the systems it created and it's just fun diving into battles. 
I just have some gripes with the game, I feel like some enemies just exist to be damage sponges and you can slap them around for minutes, it's the only reason I could not really stomach chaos difficulty and the raw mountains of cash and materials required top off your gear is loco (1,5mil to upgrade mithril spear to +10).
However the systems for grinding and dragging enemies together with dark bottle is really fun and feels rewarding though when you get 15 drops at once.
The story is good, I like a good fury driven story with some feels shining through and I like the characters for not just being the nicest and friendliest people ever with some quirks in the end, it kept me engaged enough to talk to lots of NPCs (I just skipped through when I noticed the dialogue was going in the direction of "what are we cooking today?") and look for every voice acted event, the voice range of Rokuro english VA from raspy guy to raspy guy just made me switch to JP fast.
Minigames are nice as well, we have a serving minigame, tony hawk lite and much more, fishing was just unnecessary though but it was fun collecting minigame coins to buy some new outfits and accessoires.
Well spent 5€, I got some pirate costumes as well later.

184908234.review:
6.5/10

My first Tales game, and overall, it was a fun experience playing through the game. The story wasn't the deepest or best, but it was enjoyable enough to want to finish the game and see how it all ended. I also enjoyed the abundant number of the little character cutscene things that would pop up when you were running around, and my game stats said I had seen around 320 of them. It made the characters a bit more enjoyable. All of the main cast are given little side arcs to see a bit more of their backstory, and I enjoyed the depth it gave. I think the character development between most of the characters was done pretty well. Rokurou and Eizen were my favorites. Also, it was a nice change with the main characters being more evil than just the typical good guys.

Combat was fun, I enjoyed it, and the level up system wasn't too grindy, though I had hoped it could have been a bit harder, as I played on hard mode and beat the main boss at like level 56, when the main boss was like 65. I enjoyed taking all of the different moves and trying to find ones that connected well with each other to maximize damage and status effects. Even if you had to grind, it was very easy, just get a darkness potion and gather a group of enemies in a field.

My main gripe with the game is how much it makes you run around without any warp points or anything. It gives you items for warping, although much later in the game, and they often turn out to be useless because there's a cutscene in an area you need to walk to. I get the cutscene thing, but good god, did all that running suck the soul out of me. And it eventually gives you a surfboard tablet thing you can use to go faster, but of course you only get that in the latter half of the game, because it wants you to suffer. It also requires you to unlock the board in each specific area before you can use it in said areas. Also, this game had a stupid obsession with caves, and each cave was the least enjoyable thing to navigate. Puzzles were not puzzles, just chores. Want to open this door? Go all the way back and turn this crystal on, then go around and switch that crystal on. Is it on yet? Nope! You forgot to walk seventy thousand miles back to the start to switch that other one off. :(

Also, I didn't like Velvet's ending. I feel like they could have given her a better one instead of the freaky ahh ouroboros thingy. That was the main thing I disliked about the story other than Bienfu. 

i hate bienfu

184894143.review:
Velvet é uma personagem profundamente quebrada por um evento traumático logo no início do jogo, que a consome de ódio e desejo de vingança. Durante sua jornada, ela encontra outros personagens igualmente complexos, cada um com seus próprios dilemas e motivações, que se unem a ela por interesses pessoais. A narrativa me cativou por completo, trazendo dilemas morais e éticos raros no gênero, além de momentos chocantes que só poderiam surgir de um grupo de anti-heróis. A história é magistralmente contada através de cutscenes em três formatos: anime, renderização 3D e em estilo “quadrinhos”, com várias opções que enriquecem ainda mais o enredo. Apesar de o jogo ser um pouco datado, as cutscenes 3D impressionam pela riqueza de detalhes e nuances das atuações.

A jogabilidade é um RPG de ação com sistema de combos desafiador, mas acessível. O jogo vai introduzindo as mecânicas aos poucos, mas mesmo após 20 horas, ainda há novas lições no tutorial. Apesar disso, com o básico dominado, você pode montar combos de forma aleatória e se divertir apertando os botões sem muita estratégia — eu mesmo tive que aumentar a dificuldade para “Moderado”, pois estava atropelando os inimigos. O mundo é semiaberto, com áreas conectadas e sem loadings perceptíveis, e os designs das dungeons, embora previsíveis, cumprem bem seu papel. A trilha sonora é excelente, mas alguns temas se repetem e podem grudar na sua cabeça. Tales of Berseria me proporcionou uma aventura incrível. Gostei da ambientação, dos personagens, da trilha sonora, do combate e, principalmente, da história e suas reviravoltas.

184879276.review: ля, ну за 2 к в 2025 определённо брать не стоит, ждите скидку

184866816.review:
Até o momento, este é o meu jogo favorito da série Tales. Joguei apenas 3, sendo eles o Vesperia, que já finalizei, e o Zestiria, do qual joguei apenas o começo. Este texto não é exatamente uma análise, mas uma lista dos pontos que me agradaram e dos que não me agradaram no game.

Pontos Positivos
Combate
Da série Tales of, até o momento, este foi o combate que mais me agradou. No entanto, ele pode se tornar repetitivo rapidamente se você jogar apenas de um jeito. Recomendo explorar mais o sistema de combate, seja assistindo a vídeos mostrando os combos, criando seus próprios combos e variando-os de vez em quando, ou utilizando o boneco de treinamento disponível no game, feito pra você treinar. Se fizer isso, sua experiência será muito melhor.

Além disso, recomendo não enfrentar todos os monstros que encontrar pelo caminho, pois isso pode tornar o combate repetitivo. Caso queira enfrentá-los, prefira lutar contra dois grupos ao mesmo tempo. Isso não apenas aumenta a experiência, como também reduz o número de combates necessários, permitindo que você suba de nível naturalmente, sem precisar farmar.

Se o game ficar muito difícil, não hesite em alterar a dificuldade pra o modo "simples", que é o que te dá mais experiência. Depois, você pode mudar a dificuldade se preferir novamente.

Pós-Game
O pós-game também é excelente. Assim que derrotar o chefe final, ainda haverá muitas coisas pra se fazer dentro do game, somando assim 15 e 20 horas adicionais de gameplay, ou até mais.

História e Personagens
A história é outro ponto forte. A protagonista, Velvet, é muito interessante, e você realmente compra a busca dela por vingança. Isso, combinado com os demais personagens, que também são excelentes e muito carismáticos, torna tudo perfeito.

Meu personagem favorito é o Eizen, devido à sua filosofia de vida. Além disso, ele é um pirata, o que por si só já é maneiro (a steam não aceitou  a outra palavra que coloquei).

Design e Interface
Os menus do game, incluindo o inventário, são muito bonitos, com imagens dos personagens e explicando o que cada coisa faz, de forma simples, sem se tornar confuso pra o jogador.

Pontos Negativos
Esquetes
As esquetes (pequenos diálogos de cerca de um minuto e meio) aparecem frequentemente ao longo do game. Embora aprofundem mais os personagens e o universo do game, podem se tornar cansativas. Isso porque, depois de uma longa cena da história, essas esquetes vêm logo em sequência, às vezes quatro ou mais de uma só vez. Com o tempo, isso pode acabar irritando e até dando vontade de pular esses diálogos.

Tutoriais
Outro ponto negativo é a forma como os tutoriais são apresentados. Muitas vezes, explicam coisas óbvias, como interagir com uma pedra rachada que pra quebrá-la, é só dar um chute. Além disso, os tutoriais aparecem em excesso e, em algumas ocasiões, de forma consecutiva, o que pode ser cansativo.

Após rejogar o game pra platina, passei a gostar ainda mais dele. Aprofundei-me nas mecânicas e só confirmei que a história, apesar de simples, é muito boa, assim como os personagens.
Recomendo começar por este game se você deseja entrar no universo da série Tales of. O Arise também é uma excelente opção pra quem está começando, mas, se fosse pra recomeçar hoje, eu escolheria este.

Minha Nota: 9/10

I do have some problems with the gameplay itself. Being bombarded with tutorials and mechanics made my first 20 hours very confusing. 184664686.review: Игра пройдена и после нее остается осадок. Персонажи, сюжет, мир - все остается в сердце. Именно эта сторона игра наидостойнешая, она цепляет больше всего и заставляет проходить дальше. К сожалению именно заставляет, ведь Берсерия отталкивает скучным и однообразным левелдизайном и бектрекингом. Уровни редко удивляют архитектурой или насыщенностью; часто вы будете ходить по голым коридорам с разбросанными по карте врагами. В одном из случаев игра издевается загадкой: будь добр обойди пол карты, дерни за рычажок и возращайся, а если сделал что-то неверно, то сбегай обратно (убил полтора часа). Боевая система же спорна и достаточно сложно для освоения, но если приловчиться, то залипнете в ней надолго, ведь механик много, приемы обновляются и всегда требуют гибкости. При этом ленивым позволят включить автобой. И хотя он не спасет ото всего на свете, но изрядно облегчит нудный фарм.

184454450.review: As someone who's been hooked on the Tales series since Tales of Phantasia, Tales of Berseria truly stands out with its bold narrative and character development. The shift to anti-heroes is a refreshing take, especially with Velvet Crowe leading the charge. Her journey from a kind-hearted sister to a vengeful daemon is compelling, and her crew of misfits, each with their own dark pasts, adds a rich layer to the story. The pirate theme is brilliantly executed, not just in the aesthetic but in how it influences the gameplay and interactions. The character dynamics, driven by their morally gray choices, make for some of the most engaging dialogues and plot twists in the series. Berseria rekindles that adventurous spirit of the Tales games, but with a darker, more mature edge that I've grown to appreciate over the years. It's a testament to how the series can evolve while keeping its heart intact.

184256563.review:
I have played this game many times before owning it on steam. I will say, that it is even better the 4th playthrough. 
The combat is very fun if you learn how to properly change your combos in the menu, and you really feel like a raidboss as Velvet. You can literally win most battles even at harder difficulties with just Velvet and one other character. Hitting those huge combos where you chain defeat tons of enemies feels very satisfying, especially with the role-play element of being Velvet and consuming the entire battlefield. 

The music is really good, made by the guy who did all of the other Tales games, and also dark souls games, which is very evident in some of the tracks. 

The story is really great. IMO it has the best story flow and focus than any other JRPG I have played. I am a huge Tales of Symphonia fan, and have played it front-to-back at least 8 times now, but Berseria doesn't have huge sections that feel like a true slog to get through, both gameplay and story wise. 

I think that with high difficulty settings, the game's combat actually feels fun. When you understand all of the mechanics, and try to apply them in every instance possible, you will find the combat very engaging. If you just mash buttons and don't know when to breaksoul, you will be completely useless and not have fun as Velvet. Hitting a 60 hit combo solo is very cool.

184189372.review: This is quite possibly the best Tales game ever made.  It is just as good if not better than tales of Symphonia.  Berseria has an fun combat system, side quests and minigames bursting at the seems, and most importantly an truly incredible story with amazing acting that you will never forget!

183968178.review:
Has a powerful storytelling with an age old question: Will you fight the world for your loved ones or will you sacrifice the ones you love for the slight chance of bettering the world?

I would say that this game has bumped up to be one of my more favorite Tales game (still waiting for Tales of Eternia for PC) for both its story aspect as well as the combat system. Although the latter is a bit lacking and chaotic at times. I disliked Velvet for the first few hours because of her cynicism and I guess lack of characterization (All she says at that point is "REVENGE REVENGE REVENGE"). But by the end of the game, she grew on me. All the cast is great as well especially their character arcs. Though I would say that when Magilou first appeared, she caught my heart by her goofiness. For most of the time I played this game, she was my avatar. Sadly, her combat skills did not satiate my desires and so I chose other characters than her. In conclusion, GREAT GAME I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

183879108.review: 狂战是我在传说系列里玩的第一部也是我最喜欢的一部，在17年有幸玩到，现在终于有空补票了，建议喜欢日系RPG的朋友尝试一下

183825372.review:
My entry point to the tales of series, and the game successfully sold me on becoming a tales of fan. This story if you haven't read a synopsys is about our neutral-good protag being thrust into a world of madness after a failed ritual on a boy she take care of that would remove evil from their world goes wrong. Our Protag finds herself being labelled the root of all evil, and must become it to survive. 

The gameplay is enjoyable, and the challenges rarely got in the way of progressing the story; which is the highlight of this game. The characters you meet along the way give this game my favorite group dynamic in all of the tales games, and the character development within the story is wonderful.

Pick this game up on sale if you are craving an anti-hero story.

183763351.review:
Not a game for everybody. I use this game as my bedtime story. I'm not even kidding. It's that boring for me. Everything is well executed. No doubt about that. Maybe I'm just getting too old, and the melodrama isn't for me. So why the thumbs up? Cause this game did nothing wrong.

TLDR: if you aren't into that much jrpg drama, this game will make you sleep.

183760732.review:
“无垠的海洋、南方的岛屿、冰封的大地，还有喷吐烈焰的高山全都很美。
 这就是莱菲想要环游的世界。”
主线剧情和角色塑造非常非常完美，主角团和反派们（额……似乎主角团就是反派？）全程智商在线没有降智没有拖沓，女主更是异世界大西王一路上只有杀杀杀杀。在爽快的同时又立意深刻，真是顶级剧本。
可惜如此精彩的故事被玩法拖了后腿，地图设计非常差劲，不仅又大又空而且主角跑得非常慢，探索动力也就是收集猫魂换点小饰品，跑图体验极差。而且解谜做得也很差，让我数次红温破防。战斗还挺有意思，围绕着心魂爆发的战斗鼓励我主动出击打眩晕，越主动输出越高越持久。但是坏在战斗的重复度太高了，小怪换皮boss战刮痧。到了中后期就完全腻了，一个怪都不想打，踩上滑板赶紧跑路。
太喜欢传说系列“反抗与创造”的主题了，在一个充满了压迫与奴役的世界中四处游历收集队友，最后齐心协力打破旧秩序创造出幸福未来的故事总是能感动我。旅途中无数小剧场所打造出的日常感与冒险感会在结局时爆发出难以想象的冲击力。
“我想为这世界带来的是——
 让心灵不堪重负之人能够重新来过的明天
 让想要展翅高飞之人能够闭羽阖翼的片刻
 期望坚强又软弱、可怕又温柔的人类
 未来都能到达天空的另一端
 为这世界带来『白银烈焰』！”

183724559.review: Do you enjoy female protagonists? Do you like a good revenge story now and then? Do you like sailing the seven seas with a crew of rapscallions? Do you like zany characters with so much development and personality that you may even be complaining about too much of it by the end? Do you like button-mashing combat that punishes you randomly because an enemy happened to stun-lock you before you had a chance to guard and the dodge is so delayed that there was nothing you could do so you just get killed in 3 seconds and your allies will never revive you?? ...Okay that last one is just a nit-pick, in point of fact this game is awesome and you should play it. Especially because the sale price is an insane value-for-money. I bought dlc costumes just so I wouldn't feel like I robbed the developers (and also because Velvet...).

183671362.review:
A kind of prequel to Tales of Zestiria which is light years ahead in everything. The PC port isn't anything to write home about, but still way ahead of the terrible 30 FPS lock which was in Zestiria. It's locked at 60 though.

Characters are great, combat is decent, albeit enjoyable, and the story was good too, which was a very good contrast compared to Zestiria. Still if you can withstand Zestiria's quirks, it is a good idea to play it before this game, so the story hits a bit harder, although not necessary. You have some things linked, but the biggest one is the impact of the consequences caused by the ending.

I have to warn that this game, like other tale's games, is a bit grindy, so if you don't like grinding, you can just turn down the difficulty and cruise through the story.

As someone new to the series, I've quite enjoyed this game!

183621809.review:
I know it says that I played for 7 hours, but trust me when I say that I completed the game with at least 45 hours logged. I played on the Steam Deck and for some reason I couldn't get achievements or my play time to be accurately archived. It might have been because I was mostly playing offline. I don't really care though, because after reaching the end of the game, I can confidently tell you that Tales of Berseria was not very fun for me. 

After coming off the heels of Tales of Arise and Scarlet Nexus, I was really looking forward to this game with high expectations. Those are the only two other JRPGs I've played, so I knew that there was always going to be a longggg wind-up duration until I actually started liking the game. So I played 5 hours. Then I reached 10. Then struggled to reach 15. Took a break from the game in order to reach 25 hours... By the time I reached the 30 hour mark, I was committed to just finishing the game, so I had to push myself into playing it.

Unlike the two aforementioned, there was never a single point in my playthrough when I went to bed and thought, "wow, I can't wait to play and see what happens tommorow!" It was always, "ok, my quota is done. I can't do this game anymore." Don't get me wrong: the characters are really interesting and I love their more niche quirks. And there are some really funny moments (coo-coo)!  But I can only handle Violet's character (before she started to really open up/"REVENGE FOR MY BROTHER") or "You are the captain of your soul"-esque scenes until I started getting tired of it. It's totally in-character for them and understandable, but come on... The combat was a sight to behold with all the flashy movements and skills, but after a while, it just started getting tedious. 

I will say that the last 15 hours of the game were the best part of it. Getting to see everyone's respective story arcs being resolved was great, and the ending graphics during the credits was really sad. But that's hardly enough to justify the slug that is the rest of the game.
